{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3000187,"name":"Cole","username":"ColeH","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/c/a88e4f/{size}.png","created_at":"2022-01-29T23:44:55.462Z","cooked":"

Hello,
I am using the Rev Neo integrated encoder and I am able to read the position value, but I don’t know what units that translates into.

Thanks for any help you can provide.

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":6,"updated_at":"2022-01-29T23:44:55.462Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":91,"reads":84,"readers_count":83,"score":501.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":401748,"topic_slug":"how-to-interpret-encoder-position","display_username":"Cole","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":50748,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/how-to-interpret-encoder-position/401748/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true,"can_vote":false},{"id":3000189,"name":"Kyle Hildebrand","username":"kyleh8892","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/kyleh8892/{size}/154922_2.png","created_at":"2022-01-29T23:48:00.675Z","cooked":"

The default position output is in rotations of the output shaft.

You can use .setPositionConversionFactor() to automatically convert position to your own units like meters.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":6,"updated_at":"2022-01-30T00:33:19.794Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":82,"readers_count":81,"score":46.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":401748,"topic_slug":"how-to-interpret-encoder-position","display_username":"Kyle Hildebrand","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":37493,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/how-to-interpret-encoder-position/401748/2","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":true,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3000198,"name":"Cole","username":"ColeH","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/c/a88e4f/{size}.png","created_at":"2022-01-30T00:34:11.231Z","cooked":"

Thank you! How do I find/calculate the conversion factor for my desired units?

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":6,"updated_at":"2022-01-30T00:34:11.231Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":69,"readers_count":68,"score":28.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":401748,"topic_slug":"how-to-interpret-encoder-position","display_username":"Cole","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":37493,"username":"kyleh8892","name":"Kyle Hildebrand","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/kyleh8892/{size}/154922_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":50748,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/how-to-interpret-encoder-position/401748/3","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3000201,"name":"Kyle Hildebrand","username":"kyleh8892","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/kyleh8892/{size}/154922_2.png","created_at":"2022-01-30T00:42:22.533Z","cooked":"

You have to use the gear ratio from your motor to your output shaft. I think the standard AndyMark chassis has a ratio of 10:1. Then you need to calculate the circumference of your wheels. Divide the circumference by the gear ratio to get your conversion calculation.

10.71:1 to be specific for the AndyMark AM14U5 kitbot chassis in its default configuration
